metadata.title: [System Name] FedRAMP Security Assessment Report (SAR)

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.desc: The organization that prepared this SAR.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.desc: The organization for which this SAR was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: Security Assessment Plan Approval
roles.desc: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SAR.

roles.title: Assessment Team
roles.desc: The individual or individuals performing the assessment.

roles.title: Assessment Lead
roles.desc: The individual leading the assessment activities.

roles.title: Penetration Test Team
roles.desc: The individual or individuals performing the penetration test.

roles.title: Penetration Test Lead
roles.desc: The individual leading the penetration test activities.

roles.title: Assessment Organization's Managerial POC
roles.desc: The management-level POC within the assessor's organization accountable for the organization's assessment performance.

roles.title: CSP POCs During Testing
roles.desc: At least three CSP testing points of contact must be identified in a FedRAMP SAP.

roles.title: CSP Operations POC
roles.desc: An operations center role, such as a SOC or NOC.

roles.title: CSP's End of Testing Notification POC
roles.desc: A role for an individual within the CSP to be notified by the assessor when testing is complete.

roles.title: CSP Results POCs
roles.desc: A role for the individuals within the CSP who are to receive the assessment results.

locations.title: Assessor's HQ
locations.remarks:
The assessor's HQ, or the address of the assessment team's primary business
               location.

parties.remarks: Replace sample 3PAO information.\n\nIf the assessor is A2LA Certified, include the ISO/IEC-17020

prepared-by.remarks: Exactly one party\n\nThis is the assessor.

prepared-for.remarks:
Exactly one party.

This is the UUID for the CSP in the SSP.

If no OSCAL-based SSP exists, create a CSP party in the SAP, and provide that UUID here.

csp-operations-center.remarks:
Exactly one party

The party-uuid should reference a party in the SSP.

If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP, the SAP tool should add a party to
               the SAP, or have the CSP add the party to the SSP..

The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.

csp-assessment-poc.remarks:
There should be at least three CSP Assessment POCs.

At least one should be available 24x7 during assessment activities.

At least one should be an operations center, such a SOC or NOC.

The party-uuid should reference a party in the SSP or SAP.

If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP or SAP, the SAR tool should add a
               party to the SAR.

The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.

metadata.remarks:
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SAR Template can be used for the FedRAMP initial or annual
            assessment reporting.

import-ap.remarks:
FedRAMP prefers the path for the SAP be relative to the location of this SAR file.
            Absolute links will not work when FedRAMP tools import the content.\n\nThis may point to a back-matter resource using a URI fragment.

control-group.description:
Include all controls in the SSP's baseline, except as explicitly excluded
               elsewhere.

control-objective-group.description:
Includes all objectives for all in-scope controls as defined in the controls
               assembly.

includes.name: components
includes.description: A description of the included components.

includes.name: inventory-items
includes.description: A description of the included inventory-items.

includes.name: locations
includes.description: A description of the included locations.

includes.name: users
includes.description: A description of the included users.

excludes.name: inventory-items
excludes.description: Exclude identified Windows laptop from scans.

efa0013f-d35b-43a3-a8b6-674740e6af62.description: A Windows laptop, which is not defined in the SSP inventory.

parts.name: authorization-statement
parts.prose: Priority levels were established based on [describe].

parts.name: authorization-statement
parts.prose: Notes and other information the assessor may wish to provide related to a continued authorization recommendation.

parts.name: authorization-statement
parts.prose:
[3PAO Name] attests that the SAR from the [system name] [initial | annual] 
               assessment testing provides a complete assessment of the applicable FedRAMP 
               controls as stipulated in the SAP. Evidence to validate the successful implementation 
               of the various security controls has been collected and validated. Based on the 
               remaining risks, and continuous improvements of security related processes and 
               controls, [3PAO Name] recommends a continued authorization be granted for 
               the [system name].

test-methods.title: [SAMPLE]Forceful Browsing
test-methods.description:
We will login as a customer and try to see if we can gain access to the Network
               Administrator and Database Administrator privileges and authorizations by navigating
               to different views and manually forcing the browser to various URLs

test-methods.title: [SAMPLE]CAPTCHA
test-methods.description: We will test the CAPTCHA function on the web form manually

test-methods.title: [SAMPLE]OCSP
test-methods.description: We will manually test to see if OCSP is validating certificates.

tasks.title: Send Final Version of SAR to CSP and ISSO

include-activities.description: Port scans and other network service interaction and queries
Network sniffing, traffic monitoring, traffic analysis, and host discovery
Attempted logins or other use of systems, with any account name/password

Attempted structured query language (SQL) injection and other forms of input
               parameter testing
Use of exploit code for leveraging discovered vulnerabilities
Password cracking via capture and scanning of authentication databases
Spoofing or deceiving servers regarding network traffic
Altering running system configuration except where denial of service would result

exclude-activities.description: Modification of user files or system files
Telephone modem probes and scans (active and passive)

Intentional viewing of [CSP Name] staff email, Internet caches, and/or personnel
               cookie files
Exploits that will introduce new weaknesses to the system
Intentional introduction of malicious code (viruses, Trojans, worms, etc.)

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]TCW Objective AC-1.a.1.3 (Examine and Interview)
findings.description: An overall statement about the system's satisfaction of this objective.

observations.title: [EXAMPLE]Examine AC Policy
observations.description: [EXAMPLE]The AC policy existed, and had all the required elements.
observations.remarks:
The subject-reference identifies a policy that was reviewed and is attached in the back-matter.

The observation source is linked to the task in the schedule associated with performing document reviews.

Even though the policy may be defined in the SSP and OSCAL would allow the SAR to reference it, FedRAMP requires the assessor attach all evidence to the SAR..

observations.title: [EXAMPLE]AC Policy Interview
observations.description: [EXAMPLE]The person interviewed knew about the policy and where to find it.

evidence-group.description: This describes the evidence, and adds relevant detail.\n\nFor example, this could cite where to find this information in interview notes.
evidence-group.remarks:
The subject-reference is linked to the person interviewed.

The observation source is linked to the task in the schedule associated with performing staff interviews.

The relevant-evidence is linked to the interview notes.

These may be defined in the SSP, SAP, or SAR. Tools should check all three locations.

risks.title: Risk Title
risks.description:
This is a description of the identified risk.

TCW: Identified Risk.

Scans: Vulnerability Description.

Pen Test: Risk Description.

RET: Description.
risks.risk-statement:
This is a statement about the identified risk.

TCW: Risk Statement..

Scans: N/A.

Pen Risk Statement.

RET: Risk Statement.

remediation-group.title: Remediation Title
remediation-group.description:
A description of the recommended remediation.

TCW: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').

Scans: Tool's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')

Pen Test: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')

RET: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').

POA&M: CSP's intended remediation (no type flag).

observations.title: [EXAMPLE]Missing Procedure
observations.description: [EXAMPLE]The SSP describes a procedure that does not exist in the official repository.

evidence-group.description: An attached screen shot showing the list of authoritative procedures in the repository.

observations.remarks: If this was an issue where an inventory-item or component was not configured as described in the SSP, this observation could also include a subject-reference for each item that does not match the SSP.

risks.title: Risk Title
risks.description:
This is a description of the identified risk.

TCW: Identified Risk.

Scans: Vulnerability Description.

Pen Test: Risk Description.

RET: Description.
risks.risk-statement:
This is a statement about the identified risk.

TCW: Risk Statement..

Scans: N/A.

Pen Risk Statement.

RET: Risk Statement.

remediation-group.description:
A description of the recommended remediation.

TCW: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').

Scans: Tool's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')

Pen Test: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')

RET: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').

POA&M: CSP's intended remediation (no type flag).

findings.title: Discovery Scan Results
findings.description: The results of the discovery scan.

evidence-group.description: Raw scanner tool output - discovery scan.

observations.remarks:
Undocumented hosts are entered into the SAR's assessment-subjects, local-definitions section as inventory-items or components.

Undocumented hosts are listed in the observations assembly as subject-references.

The origin must contain the UUID of the tool used to perform the scan.

findings.remarks: The UUID for the tool operator must be listed as the party-uuid for the finding. There may be more than one.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]Infrastructure Scan Unique Vulnerability
findings.description: An example set of infrastructure scan findings.

evidence-group.description: Raw scanner tool output - Infrastructure and OS Scan.

observations.title: Operational Requirement
observations.description: Provide the justification for the operational requirement.

evidence-group.description: A screen shot showing the system impact when patch is applied.
Vendor detail describing why this happens.
A screen shot showing the setting is correct
Vendor detail describing why this happens.

observations.title: Risk Adjustment
observations.description: Describe the risk adjustment justification here.

risks.title: Vulnerability Title
risks.description: This is a description of the vulnerability provided by the tool.
risks.risk-statement: This is a statement about the identified risk as provided by the tool.\n\nThis field must be present, but may be blank (or state 'No Risk Statement' if no statement is provided by the tool.

mitigating-factors.description: Describe why the cited implementation statement justifies lowering the risk.

remediation-group.title: Tool's Recommendation
remediation-group.description: A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the tool.
remediation-group.remarks: Recommended and planned remediation entries should remain when the risk is closed.\n\nSimply add the closure-actions field and change the risk-status to \"closed\".

remediation-group.title: Assessor's Recommendation
remediation-group.description: A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the assessor.
remediation-group.remarks:
The assessor may add their recommendation in addition to the tool's recommendation, or if no tool recommendation is provided.

The assessor should leave the tool recommendation, even if adding their own.

Recommended and planned remediation entries should remain when the risk is closed.

Simply add the closure-actions field and change the risk-status to "closed".

risks.closure-actions:
Describe what action(s) the CSP took to close the risk.

Normally the closure-actions field is only present when the risk-status is "closed".

If the risk-status field is set to "open" this field is ignored.

[EXAMPLE]Applied patch. Vulnerability no longer found in subsequent scan.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]Spear Phishing Results
findings.description: The Results of the spear phishing test.

observations.description: [EXAMPLE]Spear phishing test yielded a 22% click rate.\n\n[EXAMPLE]The target threshold was below 20%.

findings.remarks: When reporting a result for a test such as the spear phishing activity, a risk assembly is required if the result is to be reported in the Risk Exposure Table.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]Penetration Test Result
findings.description: A finding from penetration testing activities.

risks.title: Risk Title
risks.description: This is a description of the issue found by the penetration testing team.
risks.risk-statement: This is a statement about the identified risk identified by penetraton testing.

remediation-group.title: Assessor's Recommendation
remediation-group.description: A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the assessor.
remediation-group.remarks: The assessor may add their recommendation.

findings.remarks: If a penetration test result is positive, such as to say the SOC detected the activities appropriately, no risk is required.\n\nIf a penetration test result identifies a vulnerability or deficiency, the risk assembly is required.

observations.title: [EXAMPLE]
observations.description: [EXAMPLE]This is the contents of the Observations and Evidence cell in the TCW.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Interview Notes
resources.remarks:
A tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]AC Policy
resources.remarks:
A tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Screen Shot
resources.remarks:
A tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Raw Scan Results - Discovery Scan
resources.desc: Raw scan results exported from the scanning tool.
resources.remarks:
A SAR tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Raw Scan Results - OS and Inf Scans
resources.desc: Raw scan results exported from the scanning tool.
resources.remarks:
A SAR tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: Penetration Test Report
resources.remarks:
A SAR tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

FedRAMP is formulating guidelines for handling digital/electronic signatures in OSCAL, and welcome feedback on solutions.

For now, FedRAMP recommends one of the following:

* Render the OSCAL SAR content as a PDF that is digitally signed and attached.
* Render the OSCAL SAR content as printed pages that are physically signed, scanned, and attached.


If your organization prefers another approach, please seek prior approval from the FedRAMP PMO.
